name: Tandoori Chicken
ingredients: Fresh cilantro and lime wedges, for serving
method: In a blender or food processor, blend onion, ginger, garlic, lemon juice, and oil until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Add yogurt, salt, and 1/4 cup tandoori masala and mix until combined.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels; season with salt. Using your hands, thoroughly rub marinade into chicken. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 8 hours or up to 24.
Preheat oven to 400˚. Set a wire rack in a large sheet pan. Arrange chicken on rack (no need to let excess marinade drip off).
Bake chicken until cooked through and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest part registers 165°, about 30 minutes. Heat broiler on low and broil until lightly charred, about 5 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a platter. Top with cilantro and serve with lime wedges alongside.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
Naan bread or rice, for serving
method: In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and salt. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 8 hours.

In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt ghee or butter over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until softened and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Add crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Using an immersion blender or transferring to a blender, puree the tomato mixture until smooth. Return to skillet or Dutch oven and add marinated chicken. Cook over medium heat until chicken is cooked through, about 10-12 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and stir in heavy cream. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt to taste. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with naan bread or rice.

name: Chana Masala
method: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until softened and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and ginger paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, garam masala, and salt. Stir well and cook for 1 minute.
Add diced tomatoes, water, and chickpeas. Stir well and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened and the chickpeas are tender.
Stir in lemon juice and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with rice, naan bread, or roti.

name: Samosas
method: Make the dough: In a large bowl, combine flour, salt, and oil. Mix well until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add water gradually and knead to form a smooth and pliable dough. Cover and set aside for 30 minutes.

Make the filling: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add onion and green chili pepper and cook until onion is soft and lightly browned, about 5 minutes.

Add potatoes, green peas, coriander powder, turmeric, garam masala, and salt. Stir well to coat the vegetables with the spices. Cover and cook over low heat until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool.
Divide the dough into 12 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and flatten slightly. Roll each portion into a circle about 6 inches in diameter.

Cut each circle in half. Take one half and fold it into a cone, sealing the edges with water. Fill the cone with the potato and pea mixture, leaving some space at the top. Seal the top edge with water. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the samosas and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
method: Make the marinade: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, vegetable oil, garam masala, cumin, turmeric, and salt. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Arrange the marinated chicken pieces in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.

Meanwhile, make the sauce: In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger paste and cook for 1 minute. Add the garam masala, cumin, and paprika and cook for 1 minute.
Add the crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the heavy cream, salt, and cayenne pepper and stir to combine. Add the cooked chicken pieces to the sauce and simmer for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread, and garnish with chopped cilantro.

name: Palak Paneer
ingredients: 1 lb. paneer cheese, cut into bite-sized cubes
1 lb. fresh spinach, washed and chopped
method: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add the minced garlic, ginger paste, and chopped green chilies to the pan and sauté for another minute.
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and cayenne pepper to the pan and stir to combine.
Add the chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes.
Transfer the spinach mixture to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.

Return the spinach mixture to the pan and add the cubed paneer cheese. Cook over low heat for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cheese is heated through and the flavors have melded together.
Add the heavy cream to the pan and stir to combine. Cook for another minute or two until the cream is heated through.
Season with salt to taste and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
method: Rinse the basmati rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in cold water for 30 minutes.
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and sauté until softened and lightly browned.
Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, and sliced green chilies to the pot and sauté for another minute.
Add the cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and cayenne pepper to the pot and stir to combine.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and stir to coat with the spice mixture. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the chicken is browned on all sides.
Add the plain yogurt to the pot and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.

While the chicken is cooking, drain the rice and add it to a large pot with 4 cups of water. Add the bay leaves, cloves, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick to the pot and stir to combine. Bring the rice to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
To assemble the biryani, spread half of the cooked rice on the bottom of a large serving dish. Top the rice with the cooked chicken and then cover with the remaining rice.
Garnish the biryani with chopped fresh cilantro and serve hot.

name: Aloo Gobi
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower, cut into small florets
method: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and sauté until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté until softened and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the diced potatoes to the pan and stir to coat with the onion and spice mixture. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the potatoes are lightly browned.
Add the cauliflower florets to the pan and stir to combine. Add the turmeric, garam masala, chili powder, and salt to the pan and stir to coat the vegetables with the spices.
Add the water to the pan and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the water has been absorbed.
Garnish the Aloo Gobi with chopped fresh cilantro and serve hot.

name: Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
method: In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cayenne pepper, paprika, and garam masala. Add the chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the marinated chicken to the pan and sauté until cooked through and lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
Add the tomato paste to the pan and stir to combine with the chicken. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the tomato paste has darkened in color.
Reduce the heat to low and stir in the heavy cream and unsalted butter. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Season with salt to taste and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Samosas
method: To make the dough, combine the flour, salt, and vegetable oil in a large mixing bowl. Gradually add water and knead the dough until it forms a smooth ball. Cover the dough and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
To make the filling, heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chili and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add the diced potatoes and frozen peas to the pan and stir to coat in the spice mixture. Cook for 10-15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Stir in the chopped cilantro and salt. Remove from heat and let the filling cool.
To assemble the samosas, divide the dough into 8-10 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball and then flatten it into a disc. Cut each disc in half to form two semicircles.

Take one semicircle and roll it into a cone, overlapping the edges slightly and sealing them with a little water. Fill the cone with about 1 tablespoon of the filling and seal the top edge with a little water. Repeat with the remaining dough and filling.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Fry the samosas in batches until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with your favorite chutney or dipping sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
method: For Chole (Spicy Chickpeas):
Heat oil in a pressure cooker, add cumin seeds and allow them to splutter.
Add onions, ginger, and garlic paste, and sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add coriander powder, red chilli powder, garam masala, and salt, and mix well.
Add soaked chickpeas and 3 cups of water, and pressure cook for 10-15 minutes or until soft and tender.
For Bhature (Fried Bread):
In a mixing bowl, add flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, oil, and yogurt.
Knead into a soft and smooth dough using water as required.
Cover the dough and allow it to rest for 30 minutes.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into small discs using a rolling pin.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying and fry the bhature until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with chole.
